title: Give me tips: Learning to Jungle - Failure is Progress (Master Yi)

embed.description: A fail compilation of my jungling experience with Master Yi in League of Legends. Hope you enjoy!

body:
Hi I'm new to League of Legends as you can probably tell from the video. I decided to make a fail compilation for your enjoyment feel free to give me tips to improve my gameplay.
Thanks

replies.body:
AP on yi is bad, remove where ever you are getting that AP from...

AS reds and quints, AR yellows. anything blues. start double golems/krugs, use smite for the on hit bonus.
when you get to red, with lvl 1 Q and lvl 1 W. AA once and then as it goes to hit you, use Q, then kill 1 of the small minions and your Q should be back up. as the red is about to hit again, then use Q to dodge the damage. should be easy clear from there. after clearing red, use W to heal and then do wraiths, using the same "q before it hits you" method. it dodges damage really easily.

ty I will use q dodge you mentioned

could you please explain this "AS reds and quints, AR yellows. anything blues. start double golems/krugs, use smite for the on hit bonus."
I have no idea what you are saying sorry.

AS = attack speed.
reds = marks, a rune type.
quints = quintessenses, another rune type.
blues = glyphs, another rune type.
double golems/krugs = new name for the 2 rock monsters on the side of the jungle near the red buff.
use smite for the on hit bonus = smiting the krugs gives a buff, where every 5th attack you stun the monster you are attacking. with yi, his double hit passive makes him get to the 5 stacks very fast. meaning you can hit more and almost chain the stun taking less damage from the monsters.
each of the camps big monster gives a smite bonus if you use smite on it. krugs is the on hit stun (also can be used to do 1 hit of bonus damage to a tower)
gromp (big blob thing over near blue buff) gives a poison, that damages the monster attacking you. but only when it attacks you. so not very good for yi, as you are meant to be using Q to kill small minions quickly taking less damage, and then hitting as fast as you can to kill a monster quickly.
wolves gives a little orb that helps to see if anyone is trying to walk into your blue side of the jungle. good if you start krugs into red and then use smite on wolves so you can go back to base to buy upgraded jungle item. but a good yi shouldnt need to go back to base that early.
raptors (deadly birdlike monsters close to the mid lane tower) give a true site bonus, that boosts your move speed and gives vision if a ward is close to you during its duration. but it only activates once. so if you notice the speed boost, quickly search for the ward and kill it for gold. otherwise its wasted after about 10 seconds.

red and blue also give a bonus when smited, red buff returns a % of your max HP back when you smite. so pref use smite on the buff to kill it, for maximum HP return. well really it doesnt matter when you smite it...but only smite it to get the HP back if you need it.
blue buff does the same, but for mana instead of HP. basically there is no need to ever smite blue. unless you get to it with not enough mana to use abilities to kill it...then start the fight with the smite so you can use abilities. but yi shouldnt have a problem. since E and auto attacks can easily take out blue buff without needing Q or W.

basically, look up cowsep guides on yi. he is by far the best yi in the world. especially at explaining HOW to do the things that make a better yi.

> AP on yi is bad

INB4 Yi rework = AP IS LIKE BACON.

While Master Yi is arguably one of the easiest junglers to learn, I noticed you had AP, which means you don't have a full rune page set (most likely). A fully setup run page can be important on every jungler. I play people who aren't meant to jungle as jungle sometimes, and my runes and masteries let me survive better than you did as Master Yi.
However, you are level 14.
Don't rush getting your runes until like 20, is the first point. You want those tier 3 runes, baybee. Running a good mastery page is pretty much just as important and, in some cases, more so. What you probably want to do is get some of the defence you plan on using for level 30 masteries before the offence, as taking less damage may benefit you more for those early clears.
What do I suggest you do though? Even though Master Yi is one of those easy junglers, he is squishy and his early clears can be difficult to complete without the proper runes and masteries. He has inbuilt sustain on his meditate, but that isn't working as well as it could for you. 
Go into custom games with a friend, just one is all you need. Get them to leash your first camp for you (I assume you know what that is? If not, that might be part of why your first clear leads to an execute) and test out your clearing potential from there. Once you are done practicing (it can only take 5 minutes), you can just leave. Steer clear of your friend leashing you as someone who can shield or heal you though, as you aren't always gonna get someone like that. That way, you can test what masteries are going to let you clear the safest. Its what I do when I want to test jungle stuff. 
When you back for that first time, if you have the gold, you can buy more healing potions if you must.
Another good thing some people will before they have the proper runes and masteries is take heal/barrier in place of flash. Flash is, quite arguably, a much better choice. However, if you need one of those to finish your first clear or two, take one of them. After all, Master Yi has his ult and his Alpha Strike which allow him to get in out too. 
Another thing you can do is try other junglers. Some of them are just more forgiving for people who do not yet have the right setups. Warwick has a lot of self-healing which he gets from fighting the jungle monsters, and so does Fiddlesticks. They are both reasonably cheap, I believe (I could be wrong) and easy to learn champions. Warwick specifically, once reaching level six, has some of the easiest ganks.
I hope this all helps you to some extent. I would say more but I don't play much jungle.

Thank you so much for your help.
I will try out your suggestions
